channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipped Fridge Freezer & 5 Black bin bags, 10th December
item.description:
Someone has pulled up into a disabled bay on Alnwick Road in the night and dumped a fridge freezer and black bin bags on the pavement. This is an ongoing issue with waste regularly being dumped at this location and it needs to be dealt with by the council

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mottingham Lane, Mottingham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Medium sized white good flytipped on footpath - Wentworth Crescent, 10th December
item.description:
Please pick up and remove this item asap. Looks like it could be an extractor unit of some sort. Please remove as quickly as possible to deter others from adding to it. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37-62, Wentworth Crescent, Peckham, Greater London

item.title: Urgent -Ongoing Fly tipping outside Living Word Of Faith Church, 10th December
item.description:
Urgent Action Required- ongoing fly tipping outside Living Word of Faith Church - 4 Livesey Place, SE15 6SL This is a great concern and growing frustration regarding the persistent fly tipping outside the entrance of our church. Every week and weekend without fail, a pile of rubbish is dumped outside the church's entrance typically on Sunday morning. This has become a constant problem that is now worsening, The rubbish is unsightly, creates an offensive smell and present increasingly health and safety risk to our congregation and the wider community. Despite reporting this issue to the Council multiple times and despite repeated assurances that the area would be cleared on Saturday evening and Sunday mornings, the problem continues unabated. We urgently need your support in; Consistent and timely removal of the waste each week to avoid pest infestation. Investigation and enforcement measures to identify and deter those responsible. Long term preventative action such as signage or barriers to stop further dumping. Our church entrance should not be a weekly dumping ground and the community deserves better than the condition currently allowed to persist. we kindly ask that this matter is treated urgently and as a priority with clear plan of actions and steps to be taken and when please. Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious issue. We look forward to your continued support as always.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
